alert.note: Alert for Baker; Decatur; Dougherty; Miller (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 18 at 2:53PM EDT until March 18 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT/230 PM CDT/ FOR NORTHEASTERN JACKSON...CENTRAL DECATUR... MILLER...WESTERN DOUGHERTY...BAKER...SEMINOLE AND SOUTHERN EARLY COUNTIES... At 252 PM EDT/152 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles southwest of Albany to 9 miles southwest of West Bainbridge, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Colquitt, Newton, Albany, Donalsonville, Bainbridge, West Bainbridge, Walker, Malone, Gordon, Iron City, Brinson, Jakin, Bascom, Recovery, Lovedale, Donaldsonville A/P, Buena Vista, Bellview, Howards Mill and Hoggard Mill. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT/600 PM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama...the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee.
